content: As stated by Beyoncé, the idea behind making "Lemonade" a visual album was to create a cohesive experience that would immerse viewers and listeners in a complete artistic world. By combining music, visual art, poetry, and various cultural references, Beyoncé wanted to create an immersive experience that would tell a story and address important social issues related to race, gender, and identity. The visual aspect of the album was also a way for Beyoncé to expand her artistic range and express herself in new ways, highlighting her skills as a singer, songwriter, dancer, filmmaker, and cultural icon.
